intro: Silene mesatlantica subsp. quilesii, commonly known as the Quilesii campion, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to withstand harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and opposite, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
